intro: Isocoma veneta var. vernonioides, commonly known as the narrowleaf goldenweed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellow composite flowers and narrow, linear leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, wind-dispersed seeds and has a compact growth habit. Its botanical features make it an important species for ecological studies in arid and semi-arid regions.
